home.altTextVideoHomeBold: The video is composed of the following clips:
home.altTextVideoHome: Butterfly on a leaf, smiling girl using a walker, Colombian mountain landscape, grandparents embracing their grandson sitting on the grass, three goats, a mother kissing her smiling son in his electric wheelchair, logo La Finca De Todos.
home.openingParagraph-1: Our world is meant to be enjoyed to the fullest! You are invited to

aboutUs.paragraphMission-1: is an opportunity to live in a fun and equitable world, where no one is left out. There is a need for spaces in nature that are fully accessible to all members of the community. At
aboutUs.paragraphMission-2: , there are no worries and no stairs – we all enter through the front door.
aboutUs.paragraphMission-3: We hope to see you soon!

infographics.mainParagraph-3: to promote full participation in all spheres of life.

infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-1: “Confronting various barriers including attitudinal barriers, people with disabilities may feel prevented from
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-7: Uneven streets or sidewalks, and architectural barriers that make it
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-8: impossible for us to access public or private spaces.
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-10: as braille, screen readers, and auditory signals.
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-12: that diminish our confidence to go out and explore our environment.
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-19: Francia Márquez said that the Ministry of Equality will be  “a mechanism to advance the effective reduction of inequality and inequity gaps in Colombia”.
infographics.paragraphhowAreWeDoing-20: is part of this call to action for the inclusion of all people in our society and to create the accessibility to reach that goal.

theFarm.title3D: 3D model of the farm and its buildings
theFarm.altTextVideo3d: 3D video of La Finca De Todos, showing its structure. Spaces and information.
theFarm.Cards-1: Presence of a sign language interpreter
theFarm.Cards-2: Wide, flat paths without architectural barriers
theFarm.Cards-5: Sound and Braille guides for navigating the Farm
theFarm.Cards-7: Service animals and companion pets are welcome
theFarm.Cards-8: Free Wifi and PC to connect to the MinTIC Relay Center
theFarm.Cards-objectives-1: Construction that respects the existing terrain to promote and protect biodiversity.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-2: Use of recycled and sustainable materials such as recycled plastic wood and guadua bamboo.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-3: Recycling of rainwater for use in crop irrigation, cleaning, and toilets.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-4: Renewable energy technology ensures the highest use of sustainable energy.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-5: Creating jobs for people with disabilities by promoting inclusive and sustainable economic growth.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-6: We provide high-quality educational programs with an emphasis on inclusion.
theFarm.Cards-objectives-7: Sustainable agricultural systems for the production of food consumed on the farm.

weekend.paragraphCards-1: Observe a spectable of colors in an accessible space dedicated to the breeding and conservation of butterflies.
weekend.paragraphCards-2: We seek to recover contact with nature in an accessible way so we can have the experience of planting, caring for, and harvesting food.
weekend.paragraphCards-3: In our accessible greenhouse, you can see smart technology implemented for lower energy use, environmental control software, and an intelligent irrigation system.
weekend.paragraphCards-4: An adaptable cockpit that allows accessible use of Microsoft Flight Simulator, a tool used by real pilots and aviation enthusiasts to experience flying around the world.
weekend.paragraphCards-4-1: Photo by  House of Wheels, Menash Cohen
weekend.paragraphCards-5: Feel with your hands or feet the textures of the countryside, smell the essence of aromatic herbs, and explore a space full of surprises for your senses.
weekend.paragraphCards-6: Here we can interact with the animals of the farm in a fully accessible environment to have the experience of milking a goat, feeding the chickens, or collecting eggs from the nests comfortably.
weekend.paragraphCards-7: A place to meditate, feel calm, and recharge positive energy in a quiet and accessible space. Design based on Zen principles and Japanese culture, this space favors serenity and meditation.
weekend.paragraphCards-8: Explore a home that is 100% accessible and constructed on principles of sustainability. Learn how we recycle rainwater, what the walls are made of, and how we turn on the wifi with technology to help our planet.
weekend.paragraphCards-9: The inclusive play area is designed for visitors of all abilities to play together. Climb the wall and reach new heights: we have adapted climbing equipment to ensure your safety.
weekend.paragraphCards-10: Taste a variety of delicacies prepared by local artisans and right here at La Finca de Todos. Freshly made with love, all ingredients were harvested here in Colombia.
weekend.paragraphCards-11: Join our Colombian Sign Language (CSL) Story Hour every weekend. Discover this beautiful language and help your child with language development. Presented by a Deaf  person or an interpreter, accompanied out loud.

donate.paragraph-1: Your support is indispensable to creating the world of equality in which we want to live.
donate.paragraph-3: La Finca de Todos Foundation is a non-profit organization, registration number 20230143627.

educationalWorkshops.paragraphMain: Our workshops are planned by teachers with a love of teaching who will help all students, with or without disabilities, become conscientious adults. Contact with nature awakens new connections in the brain while the variety of topics and activities reinforce concepts of resourcefulness, self-esteem, social responsibility, and cooperation.
educationalWorkshops.paragraphMain-2: , learning and fun go hand in hand!

infographicsPassDay.paragraphMainPassDay: A day of fun and relaxation
